text: dont have any products in HubSpot, trying to create a custom line item. As you can do in HubSpot.

Hey <@U01QVR44MEY>, 
I'm new here and just need a little explanation from you. 
I have a form built with ReactJS and at the end of the form I want to create a lead on HubSpot with the data of ReactJs form. 
Now, I can see that in my regular account of HubSpot I can create an app and get an access token to call APIs and I can create the lead. 
But then I saw that there's a Developer account which also has all stuff like this.
This is now a bit confusing like either I need to build this integration using my regular account or this developer account. 
Developer accounts are a bit different and have their own API keys and other stuff.
Hello everyone we are trying to build a HubSpot app and we want to get back email's logged to and from a ticket is there anyway to get those back through webhooks? Thanks in advance for the help

"i thought about that, but the problem is that i don't get an update hook when I associate a company, even though i'm subscribed to all relevant hooks"
Then how would you know that this doesn't work?

You can do this using just your normal account no need to create an integration. You can create a new contact (and use all the information from your custom form) using the contacts api: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
Just use the limits parameter and specify something higher than 10 but under 100
Also use the paging parameter to go to the next page
Cool thanks I'll give it a try
Thanks again <@U01QVR44MEY> works fine
Yeah for sure, let me know if you run into any more issues

Hi guys, everyday I'm getting a 500 status response from a specify endpoint
/account-info/v3/activity/login

{"status":"error","message":"There was a problem with the request.","correlationId":"e94c338a-b2d7-4d2f-9568-56b1b9aa0ff4"}
Can you help me? What are we doing wrong?

Hello team
I tried to upload a file using the newest HubSpot API - */files/v3/files/import-from-url/async*
But it's stilling giving me error below.
I've included the folderId and folderPath both, but it's saying i need to include them.

$ImportFromUrlInput = new ImportFromUrlInput([
  'access' => "PUBLIC_INDEXABLE",
  'name' => $file_name,
  'folderPath' => "hubdb",
  'folderId' => "86847531282",
  'url' => $file,
  'duplicateValidationStrategy' => "NONE",
  'duplicateValidationScope' => "ENTIRE_PORTAL",
  'overwrite' => true,
]);

It could be 2 things:
1. Your request isn't setup properly and so the api can't process it.
2. HubSpot server is down
#1 is more probable
Could you provide me any issues on my code or solution for this? Thanks!
Our request is made from AWS, on 1:00am everyday (UTC -3)
Around 9:00am UTC we try again and the request works just fine
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>
<@UD53A9UUR> I saw some of community posts and you replied to this kind of errors. Could you please advise? Thanks
For sure, I wonder if it was your AWS or HubSpot

How can I debug it?

We have a lot of integrations and everyday this week we are having problem only with this endpoint
This endpoint is in BETA, so I was wondering if there is any capacity issue
Send the request at that time from postman, if it fails then it's HubSpot
If it's fine then it's your AWS
I don't think is AWS as we are doing a some request that we get 200 response, only this one is not working
if it's HubSpot, how can I open this issue?
Use the help icon on the HubSpot dashboard
I agree it looks like HubSpot in this case
Should I open a issue in the community forum?
forum?
forum
sorry
You're good
Yeah that definitely also helps with visibility
thanks! How long do you think it will take for someone have a look at the issu?
HubSpot support will answer in a couple of minutes
Depending on the scope of the issue to resolve the problem it's anywhere from 2 day-2 weeks+

beause I log hooks on my side and i get nothing when changing associations. Also, the numofemployes hook is not directly corelated to company-contact associations, from my research. If I understand you correctly, by "calculated property" you mean if i log num of employes and check the difference?

i've managed to solve it another way, by scheduling an associations check and then syncing the database, but I would appreciate if the dev team could look into implementing a webhook that fires when a contact is associated with a company
But that isn't a property change
I wouldn't want webhooks to fire for associations, at least not the current webhooks. They are just for properties now
Got it <@U01QVR44MEY>. Thanks mate
For sure, let me know how it goes

<@U01QVR44MEY> as you can see above I have to make multiple calls,
1. Create contact.
2. Create deal.
3. Make association between contact and deal.
Is there a way to do all this in a single request? or at max in 2 requests?
Unfortunately no

Hi all, I'm new to HubSpot. My lead gen company have asked me to create a form and then give them the FORM ID and PORTAL ID. They will be generating leads and sending them to me via the form. Can you help me find the FORM ID and PORTAL ID. I created a form but there was no option to create a LEAD CAPTURE FORM so I just used standard form. Not sure if this is correct. Please help :slightly_smiling_face:
Great! thanks

Your Portal ID is your Hub ID ‚Äì click your company name on the top right, it's the number below your company name.

Your form id is the long string of letters and numbers in the url when you're on the form overview page in HubSpot (see screenshot, other stuff is redacted for privacy)
For sure, let me know how it goes
are there any plans for them to be expanded to associations as well?
Not to my knowledge, I'm voting for GraphQL subscriptions though
Sure! FYI <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Problem-with-Activity-Login-endpoint/m-p/702835#M57605>
Sick

Hello everyone,
Is it possible to get a list of all the Business Units of a portal via the HS API ?
So it can be used in an external application (preferably a list of names and IDs).
I did not find anything in the documentation.
Heck yeah
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners#endpoint?spec=GET-/crm/v3/owners/>
The owners api will tell you all the teams the person is on
Hi Carter,

Hi everyone, does anyone knows if the SMTP API for Transactional emails counts toward the daily API limit? Feel it shouldn't since transactional emails are used for critical system functionality like password reset, and running out of API calls would ruin the experience on the product. Is there an alternative to sending transactional emails without affecting the API limits?
Thanks for your reply. But I am not looking to get a list of teams for a contact.
I want to list all Business Units of a portal  (see: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account-settings/manage-brands-with-business-unit>)
Ah now I see
You can always check the headers in the response to see if the api limits are applicable to sse

<@U01QVR44MEY> one more opinion on below piece of code. this service is responsible for returning ID of the contact to be used for association with deal. It will try to create the contact, if its already there, it will get the ID from the error thrown by parsing string. Is it Okay?
It is working for sure and I adopted this method to save another request to check if contact is already created for the user (which will be true in 1% of the cases).
```const createHubSpotContact = async (contactInfo) => {
  try {
    const apiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi.create({ properties: contactInfo });
    return apiResponse.id;
  } catch (e) {
    if (e.body.message.startsWith('Contact already exists. Existing ID: ')) {
      return e.body.message.split('Contact already exists. Existing ID: ')[1];
    }
    e.message === 'HTTP request failed' ? console.error(JSON.stringify(e.response.data, null, 2)) : console.error(e.body);
    throw new ApiError(400, e.message);
  }
};```
Yeah that's definitely helpful, but it doesn't cut down the amount of steps

You still need to:
1.  call the api to create/get the contact
2. Create deal
3. Associate
yeah exactly but some help here :slightly_smiling_face:

I‚Äôm trying to send emails from a custom object. I swear this used to be a thing. Exactly like this video explains: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFoZNWL39R8>
I have created my custom object and but the associated contact nor the email field of the object itself auto populates like it used to. What step have I missed in the object creation?

Referencing, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing-api/subscriptions-preferences>

Is there anyway to know if a user is actually opted-in to a subscription vs ‚ÄúNot Specified‚Äù? From the data returned both read as ‚ÄúSubscribed‚Äù. It is important to know the difference.

And example of ‚Äúsubscribed‚Äù but not opted-in, which looks exactly the same as subscribed and opted in:
```		{
			"id": "58440113",
			"name": "New User Onboarding",
			"description": "Welcome new user! ...",
			"status": "SUBSCRIBED",
			"sourceOfStatus": "SUBSCRIPTION_STATUS",
			"brandId": null,
			"preferenceGroupName": null,
			"legalBasis": null,
			"legalBasisExplanation": null
		},```
Perhaps v1 API must be used for this? What‚Äôs the difference between v1 and v3 again?
There obviously the opt out properties but that isn't super helpful
Really interested to know the usecase for this
For example, to know if someone is subscribed to our newsletter
Are they or are they not subscribed to ‚ÄúNew User Onboarding‚Äù
And this is a custom property right
Which is a custom property?
status
it's not a default HubSpot property at least not on any of my portals

No, that which you see in my example is what is returned from the api request
I did not add any of those properties
Oh now I see that thought I was a contact property
Does the legalBasis have anything to do with it? In the example above it's null (which I would expect for a default property) what is it on a contact that opted-in?
Sorry for not being clear
You're totally good

The reason ‚ÄúI think‚Äù they both show as subscribed is that we don‚Äôt GDRP enabled, so people don‚Äôt need to explicitly opt-in to be subscribed.
We are triggering lists and workflows off of opted-in though.

I see the v1 end point does show optState, why they didn‚Äôt carry it to v3, :shrug:

So maybe I am to use v1 for this query? I don‚Äôt understand the difference of the versions and if one should be used over the other.

```{
	"subscribed": true,
	"markedAsSpam": false,
	"unsubscribeFromPortal": false,
	"portalId": 22777725,
	"bounced": false,
	"email": "<mailto:email@email.com|email@email.com>",
	"subscriptionStatuses": [
		{
			"id": 58687837,
			"updatedAt": 1665069275190,
			"subscribed": false,
			"optState": "OPT_OUT"
		},
		{
			"id": 58055302,
			"updatedAt": 1665063730551,
			"subscribed": true,
			"optState": "OPT_IN",
			"legalBasis": "LEGITIMATE_INTEREST_CLIENT",
			"legalBasisExplanation": "Requested to resubscribe via email"
		}
	],
	"status": "subscribed"
}```
Eventually those apis will be fully deprecated so use them at your own risk.
I think you're right about the GDPR thing though

Hey guys,

I'm just doing some integration work to pull in some external data into custom objects and I want to associate them with contacts via an email, but I just have some confusion over this line in the docs:

`HubSpot will automatically associate a custom object with the emails, meetings, notes, tasks, calls, and conversations objects.`

 So does that mean if I include an `email` field and then associate it with contacts in the schema like:

```"associatedObjects": [
"CONTACT"
]```
As I add new records, will this automatically do the associations?

Also, regarding the limitations on associated objects - just as a future proof thought, is there a way to increase your max associations per custom object? Or will I need to do some data pruning?

Cheers :slightly_smiling_face:
Are you trying to associate a custom object that already exists in HubSpot and has it's own ID?
If so you can just use the associations api
It's a custom object that I'm creating - so I'm looking at how to sort the schema out
I don't want to hammer the API withv extra association requests as I import like 20,000 records unless I need to, basically
Yeah so it will not associate records together unless you ask it to
Where is the quote from in the docs
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
Under the "Associations" header
Ah yeah, it's talking about being allowed to associate those objects
So the emails. meetings, notes, tasks, calls, and conversation will automatically be allowed to associate
But not *actually* associated?
No it will just allow those types of objects to be associated
That does suck a bit, since I'll need to do a lookup and associate call, but no worries I guess :]
Yeah it's is a bummer but remember that you can use the headers from the response to see how many requests to have left for the second/minute
That way you won't run into the rate limits
